reviews.title: Better than a massage
text: I read about this 'scouring and scrubbing' in a book & vowed that I'd include this in my next trip to TO. Yes - it was a great experience, and yes - I would recommend it IF you are not shy about being stark naked.

First, you shower, then jump in the hot tub, then you are called in for the scrub. There were two tables, so another lady was on the other. The scrubber is in panties & a bra & has buckets of hot water to slough you off as she scrubs. You turn over, side, stomach, etc. It felt amazing, especially my palms and soles of my feet. Like a massage, but better. I felt a bit dizzy getting up but the two scrubbers flew to my side & clucked over me & I felt entirely cared for. I would definitely recommend it.

reviews.title: Great visit. Can’t wait to go back.
text: I had my reservations based on the other reviews but once I arrived I felt much better. The entrance is a big area with lockers for your shoes. The shoe locker is linked to your locker number inside the change room. We were met by a friendly receptionist and paid for the services I chose. It was expensive compared to Korea but I think that was to be expected.

The change area was spacious and clean. I changed into my uniform and went into the common area to meet my husband, it was his first time in a Korean spa. We sat and chatted. Then tried the dry saunas in the back. Loved the ice room which cooled us down. We then had lunch which was good and was happy to see a cold and hot water dispenser.

I had a scrub and facial scheduled so I went into the wet area to prepare. Again this area was clean. Everyone in the wet area were nude but I felt comfortable which is not my usual state. I took my shower and soaked in the cold and hot pools. I didn’t try the wet sauna. The scrub and facial were great. I was surprised to see someone was already in the  scrub room. Anyway by that point I was ok with the nudity. Lisa was my scrubber. Her English wasn’t great but she was very nice and made me comfortable during the whole process.
I highly recommend this place to relax and for a scrub.
They told me they are working to update the website with more info. Our visit cost just over $200 including two entrances and my scrub and facial. Entrance fee is $30. Totally worth it.

reviews.title: It is always a good experience for me to be in that Sauna.
text: It is always an amazing experience for me, has been there many times before the Covid 19.  My last visit was on July 16, 2022.  The place is clean, relaxing, has a very friendly staff. I like all about it!

reviews.title: I have slept over a few times. The hot rooms helped during winter.
text: If you've ever been to a Jimjilbang in Korea, you will find a semblance of nostalgic atmosphere here.
Do not mistake a Jimjilbang for a place where people go to hook up. Bathhouses are a part of Korean culture. They are conservative and traditional places to take your family.

reviews.title: relaxing atmosphere
text: Relaxing atmosphere, friendly staff. Could be more variety of foods and drinks in the cafeteria. Very good place to relax with friends and/or family.

reviews.title: Mediocre Korean Sauna. Unfortunately it's because they have no other Jimjilbang competition.
text: As someone who has been to dozens of Jimjilbangs in South Korea, this is an embarrassing establishment. Maybe that's why not too many Koreans come here because they know how sad and run down this place is.
Iv'e been here many times because unfortunately this is the only Korean Sauna in the GTA. How sad...
The hot tub is nice, however the ceiling vent over the hot tub is covered in black mould, which over the years has never been cleaned.
The cold pool has gotten warmer over time, I'm not sure if they even care about keeping the temperature down anymore.
The heated rooms are nice, but out of the 6 rooms, 3 will be the same temperature, the lowest one (36 degrees) It would be nice to have varied temps throughout for a better experience.

The used to have couches but they converted them into these solid hard benches that are super uncomfortable, probably to prevent people from staying too long. The entertainment area is non-existent. There's a pool table you must pay for, some old board games at the food kiosk (not sure if you have to pay to use them) and some Korean books.

If you come at the same time as the Russians, prepare to have the worst experience because they're loud and obnoxious. Every single time I have come (about 10-12 times) there have been Russians who won't shut up and respect the be quiet sign. It's not the best place to meditate with them around so make sure to run when you hear them. Trust...you can't miss them.
Overall the hot tub and the varied rooms are pretty great, but overall Jimjilbang needs a face lift and some cleaning.
Again, a lot of these comparisons are from living in Korea, and the differences are night and day. Not to mention that in Korea 24 hour access is only $10 compared to the $28 here. But I digress.

reviews.title: Great relaxation place
text: It's a great place when you need to relax and get your mind clear again,. Super clean and excellent service

reviews.title: Terrible experience!!!
text: I have been coming here for many years, and lately it's become a very big problem to communicate with the staff, they are extremely rude with other nationalities other than Korean. Even if you schedule an appointment prior you won't be taken at that time, instead of you a Korean person will be taken, where did that person even come from? It was impossible to talk without arguing and yelling. They are saying that they lack English when taking reservations and not scheduling your appointment. When I called one day prior to scheduling my appointment, the person was speaking English very well and we discussed all the details and she confirmed that my appointment is scheduled. But the next day, when I came there, they said that there is no appointment under my name. The business owner - a very terrible person recommended to shut up and leave in a very rude and aggressive manner. I will never come back to this place and I do not recommend anyone to come here, all I experienced was stress instead of relaxation.

reviews.title: great body scrub
text: I have been fortunate enough to experience this kind of spa in Korea and similar hammams in Turkey and Morocco  This is very authentic in terms of the scrub and saunas. The body scrub is vigorous and when I say the attendant gets into every nook and cranny, I mean it!! You leave totally relaxed and baby-smooth. I would definitely go again - but just for this service. Be prepared to call the attendant when it is the time you have booked - they don't seem to adhere much to the schedule so plan to be delayed 15 min or so.

The saunas are OK but a bit crowded; there is only one small hot pool and one cold (usually you have a choice of several but really, one hot one is all you need to prepare for the scrub); the large relaxing area is irritating with children running around, TV set to Russian (!) talk program and just not very nicely decorated. But as I said - go for the scrub, it is worth it.
Keep in mind:
pay in cash for savings - bring water bottle - bring lotion as scrub will dry you out initially - bring flip flops and a towel (they supply two mini ones only)
It would be nice if the spa offered the option of coming for the scrub only so we didn't have to pay $25 admission fee on top of the $40 scrub fee.
So to sum up: go for excellent body scrub but the rest is only so-so.

reviews.title: place to unwind
text: place has a steam room, 6 sauna rooms of various temperatures, hot water soaking area, cold water plunging area, availability of water table scrubs, and massage. general admission for $25, and you can stay as many hours as you wish

reviews.title: The only Korean Spa in Toronto
text: This is currently the only Korean Spa in Toronto that offers a series of heated mineral sauna rooms. These include jade, gold, crystal, loess, etc. and an ice room for cooling down. You enjoy these in the T shirt and shorts they provide. There are bamboo mats and wood head rests to use. You go barefoot all over the facility but it is clean and I saw them cleaning constantly.
In the change rooms there are the wet areas with showers, hot and cool pool, steam room, and body scrub area. Hair dryers are provided but no moisturizer or hair products.

In the co-ed lounge area, there are massage rooms, tables and chairs, sofas, plus pool tables and some token exercise equipment. And the cafeteria which sells drinks, snacks, instant noodles and Korean sushi rolls that they make on the spot (like a small futomaki)

The heated rooms are great. I started with the least hot one and worked up to the hottest. Was sweating very quickly. But except for the sauna rooms, the place feels a bit utilitarian and run down. The wet area tiles are stained and some are loose, although the pools are in fine shape. They supplied communal bar soap! I used their dollar store shampoo instead. The sofas are faux leather which are peeling off in an ugly way. The walls in the lounge and the change room are plain white and very sterile looking. When I was there, none of the TVs were on. I had a `leg massage` - very nice on the calves, ok on the thighs, not so good on the feet.
The clientele is quite mixed, quite a few young Asians in groups, older ladies in groups, as well as couples and singles. And some very young kids as well. There was talking but not too distracting.
If you are into spas, this is at least worth a visit for the experience. Many of the clientele seem to be repeats. But I would not be coming back very soon - maybe one day.
Cash only, by the way. And bring your own towels and bath products.

reviews.title: So-so
text: This was my first time going to a place like this.  It was $25 cash for entry and you could stay as long as you like.  The line was huge when we arrived and the lady at the desk was helping staff not processing clients.  The change room area includes a steam room, hot tub and cold tub with of course showers.  This is a NO clothes zone.  For me that's not acceptable.  I don't feel comfortable with that and I had come prepared and brought a bikini to wear.  The massage staff told me to remove it and I absolutely refused - after more back and forth I left, feeling uncomfortable.  I changed to the uniform provided and went into the other area.  This is one large room with a small snack bar, two pool tables and couches and a few treadmills.  There are no arcade games as shown in their online photos.  If you wish to play pool you need cash.  We tried to have it charged to our locker and was nearly refused.  They should advertise this.  The actual sauna area was nice and the individual rooms are as shown on their website.  It was a busy day so not as relaxing as it could have been - loud people talking, kids vomiting etc.

Upon exiting you pay a tab for whatever you purchased at the snack bar.  My bill was $4.50 and I only had debit.  The minimum for debit is $10 so be sure to bring cash or spend that amount because the guy at the desk wanted to take $10 anyways.  No where does it mention this minimum.

Will I be back?  Probably not but if I do I'll continue to wear clothes in the shower area - my first visit I certainly didn't pay $25 to find out AFTERWARDS that I must be naked, what place requires that!?  They should make that known on their website so that people like me can avoid the place - it resulted in me feeling very uncomfortable and only able to enjoy half of what was offered.

reviews.title: My Meditation Spa
text: This is my very special place I come to for solitude, detoxing, and meditation.
This place is for anyone who is open hearted, open minded and well cultured. I can go from ultra luxe to traditional culture down to earth vibes.
It is a simple 24/hr Jimjilbang or as I like to call it **The 24hr Meditation Sauna**. Clean and Tidy.

Quick Tips: Bring slippers for the washroom, bring a good book, bring your favourite shampoo and conditioner, bring your favourite body scrub, and whatever else spa-like products you love, and bring your positive vibes.
Very affordable. (The food shop in the co-ed area can get pricy)
Bring your favourite pillow if you're like me and choose to sleep there. *Heaven*
I can go on and on and on... it's just an experience you have to feel in order to understand.

reviews.title: 24 hours !
text: What can you do after 6 hours of driving and getting to your hotel at 11pm ? So we all decided to go to this place that works 24h. So we arrived there at midnight, the guy at the desk was very friendly and polite. The price is fantastic and you can stay as long as you want !
Very very clean spa !
Definitely will recommend to others !

reviews.title: Scrub cleans everywhere
text: We went for a body scrub and relaxation and had a good time. Some may find the scrub intrusive if you are at all shy about being naked. The attendant scrubbed _everywhere_ with a rough loofah. It was invigorating but also a bit strange to be so exposed, scrubbed and splashed with buckets of water. All in all, a great experience. Try the baked eggs - they were delicious!

reviews.title: My Spa
text: Visited this spa with my cousin and it was a little awkward.  We booked to have a scrub and massage and didn't realize we had to be naked the whole time....no robes, no towels. Just us being scrubbed in the same room in front of other ladies doing the water circuit. But my GAWD! Was it amazing!!  Absolutely loved the scrub and massage. The saunas were great too. Looks like a basic spa in the middle of a warehouse, but so well worth the visit. It's my go to.

reviews.title: Well worth the price
text: As someone who enjoys visiting sauna's and spa's altogether I was happy to have stumbled across this location thanks to my partner. I've already visited this location twice, and definitely plan on coming back many more times! The price of admission is $20 pp which isn't bad imo (in my opinion), especially when your simply seeking to try out different sauna rooms in just one location!
Some things to note before coming to this location are:
- Pay by cash! You'll avoid unnecessary credit card fees.

- As one reviewer pointed out below, be prepared to shower naked! (unless you bring your own bathing suit to shower with). However, others will still be naked around you showering or walking in the change room. If this makes your feel uncomfortable your forewarned.
- Lots of couches to relax in the main area, along with 2 pool tables, tables& chairs and a cafe (they sell alcohol as well).
- Make sure to bring a water bottle, you'll want to stay hydrated!
-Change rooms for both males/females also have a steam room, hot tub and cold plunge pool. Definitely worth taking advantage of!

reviews.title: Be prepared to be naked
text: I was not told by my friend that there are no towels or robes at this spa. You are naked the whole time in the Ladies Room and the body scrub does not happen in a separate room but right out in public where other ladies can watch. A very uncomfortable experience but the scrub was fantastic. No one spoke english at this spa so you are kind of on your own the whole time.

reviews.title: Not good for relaxing, but great for families...
text: Facilities were good but the photos are deceiving showing just 1 person in each of the rooms. The layout was good too with a side room closed off from the main hall and then individual smaller sauna rooms, but people still did not keep quiet even though there were 2 large signs to be quiet. It was difficult to find a sauna room without an ongoing conversation from either a couple or group of friends, or even when I found a room, you could hear loud groups of families talking loud just outside the door with kids running around... Staff are so-so. When asked about keeping quiet in the sauna rooms, one lady just shrugged. The snack bar was cheap looking and provided low quality of service: cold eggs, small cups for tea bag tea and no lids (for $2!)... Tips: 1) bring your own bath towel unless 2 hand/face towels is enough for a shower after. 2) save tax if you pay cash for admission.

reviews.title: My go-to spa in the GTA
text: I have been coming out to Seoul Zimzilbang (although I believe they have recently changed the spelling to "Seoul Jimjilbang" for a couple of years now.  This year they have done some renovations that have improved the place.

Renovations:  The faux leather couches in the communal lounge area that were peeling have been replaced.  They have fourteen nice, new ones in the lounge area.  Also the wet areas have been redone.  I have not seen the women's side obviously, but the men's side has been completely re-tiled, the steam room has been rebuilt, and the wet area is also larger than it was before- having expanded into some previously wasted space in the locker room.  The hot and cold pools have been re-tiled as well.
The dry saunas (co-ed, where you wear a uniform provided) are very nice.  There are six of them, and there is also an ice room to cool off.
In the lounge area, the food is simple, and the beer selection is small, but you can eat there, and there are a couple of TVs, a pool table, and of course the couches.

The thing I appreciate most about this place is that it is open 24/7.  I can walk in at any hour of the day or night and know that my $20 entry fee is good for 24 hours.  I can get cleaned up, sleep, relax, eat, drink, and someday I will get a massage and/or scrub- but that costs extra.
My only complaint is that the WiFi is too slow.  Great place!  I will keep coming back.

reviews.title: The BEST sauna in Toronto!!!!!
text: I have been coming to the Seoul Zimzilbang Korean Sauna and I must say, as someone who is a regular spa-goer, that it is by far the best sauna in Toronto. The different mineral sauna rooms, such as jade, germanium and elvan stone, all have different but equally beneficial healthful properties. Also, due to the many options and different temperatures in each room, there is something to suit everyone's individual preferences.

This is a great option for a relaxing afternoon with family and friends. The staff have always been very polite and the whole facility is family friendly. Clothes (a loose t-shirt and shorts) are provided for everyone using the sauna and in the common area there are many large tvs for people wanting a break from the saunas, a place to buy snacks (korean chips, handrolls, soy-sauce boiled eggs..) and board games available.

Finally, as an athlete I spent many years going from place to place in Toronto looking for the best massage. Out of all the chiropractors, physio therapists and massage therapists I have ever been to, Mr.Kim at the Seoul Zimzilbang is by far the best ever! Everyone I have ever recommended come see him has said it was the best massage they have ever gotten in their lives. However, it is important to note that it is a very deep tissue massage and may be to much pain some people.
I recommend Seoul Zimzilbang for everyone looking for a little break and relaxation time with family and friends!
